tests package¶

Submodules¶

tests.test_body module¶

tests.test_body.test_bodyPos()¶

Tests the default body positions is correct

tests.test_leg module¶

tests.test_leg.test_getFeetPos()¶

Tests that the found feet positions as x, y, z points are correct given the model of the legs

tests.test_leg.test_legAngle()¶

Tests that the coax, femur, and tibia angles are correct given the end foot position. This test uses the defult leg dimensions declared by the function definition

tests.test_leg.test_legModel()¶

Tests that the found model of the legs is correct given the leg angles and body model of the starting condition of the hexapod

tests.test_leg.test_legPos()¶

Tests that the output positions of the leg segments is correct given the coax, femur, and tibia angles with the body model.

tests.test_leg.test_recalculateLegAngles()¶

Tests that all of the output leg servo angles are correct given the default body model and feet positions when the hexapod is just turned on

tests.test_leg.test_startLegPos()¶

Tests that the starting leg angles are correct when given the body model of the starting condition of the robot

tests.test_move module¶

tests.test_move.test_pollEMG()¶

Tests that the returned EMG values are between 0 and 1

tests.test_move.test_resetTurnStance()¶

Given the body and leg models right after taking a 15 degree turn, this function tests that the hexapod ends in the default resting stance after the resetTurnStance test is run. This is the same condition as when the hexapod is just turned on.

tests.test_move.test_resetWalkStance()¶

Takes the model of the body and legs right after taking a step with a distance of 15 and tests that the resetWalkStance ends with the models back at the default resting position. This position is the same as when the hexapod was turned on

tests.test_move.test_stepForward()¶

Tests that the ouput feet offsets from making one step forward are correct

tests.test_move.test_stepTurn()¶

Tests that the output feet positions of all six legs are correct when turning the hexapod one step

tests.test_move.test_stepTurnFoot()¶

Tests that the offset of the second foot when turning one step is correct

tests.test_move.test_turn()¶

Tests that the hexapod takes two turning steps correctly by checking every foot position during the turn.

tests.test_move.test_turnZero()¶

Tests that a turn angle of 0 raises an exception

tests.test_move.test_walk()¶

Tests that the output feet positions of all six legs are accurate when the hexapod moves a distance of 30.

tests.test_move.test_walkNegative()¶

Tests that the output feet positions of all six legs are accurate when the hexapod moves a distance of 30.

tests.test_rotation module¶

tests.test_rotation.test_xrot()¶

Tests that the x rotation matrix with a 90 degree rotation is correct

tests.test_rotation.test_yRot()¶

Tests that the y rotation matrix with a 90 degree rotation is correct

tests.test_rotation.test_zRot()¶

Tests that the z rotation matrix with a 90 degree rotation is correct

tests.test_ssc32uDriver module¶

tests.test_ssc32uDriver.test_angleToPW()¶

Tests that the found pulse width for a 90 degree servo positions is 1500us

tests.test_ssc32uDriver.test_anglesToSerial()¶

Tests that the message to the servo controller is made and formatted correctly and as a btye string

tests.test_ssc32uDriver.test_anglesToSerialWrongFormat()¶

Tests that an incorrectly formatted message raises an exception
